Description: Fragment of a penannular ear- or hair-ring made of jasper. One finished end preserved, the rest is broken off. Triangular in section. At the outer faces each a circumferential line at the outer edge, along the edge small notches creating a waving pattern. The inner part shows drill lines, the outer faces are well polished.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
